    • Method Detail

      • tf

        public float tf(float f,
                float collectionLenght)
        Description copied from class: BaseTFIDF
        Computes a score factor based on a term or phrase's frequency in a document. This value is multiplied by the #idf(long, long) factor for each term in the query and these products are then summed to form the initial score for a document. Terms and phrases repeated in a document indicate the topic of the document, so implementations of this method usually return larger values when freq is large, and smaller values when freq is small.
        Specified by:
        tf in class BaseTFIDF
        Parameters:
        f - the frequency of a term within a document
        Returns:
        a score factor based on a term's within-document frequency

      • idf

        public float idf(long docFreq,
                 long docCount,
                 long ttf)
        Description copied from class: BaseTFIDF
        Computes a score factor based on a term's document frequency (the number of documents which contain the term). This value is multiplied by the #tf(float) factor for each term in the query and these products are then summed to form the initial score for a document. Terms that occur in fewer documents are better indicators of topic, so implementations of this method usually return larger values for rare terms, and smaller values for common terms.
        Specified by:
        idf in class BaseTFIDF
        Parameters:
        docFreq - the number of documents which contain the term
        docCount - the total number of documents in the collection
        Returns:
        a score factor based on the term's document frequency

      • lengthNorm

        public float lengthNorm(int i)
        Description copied from class: BaseTFIDF
        Compute an index-time normalization value for this field instance.
        Specified by:
        lengthNorm in class BaseTFIDF
        Parameters:
        i - the number of terms in the field, optionally discounting overlaps
        Returns:
        a length normalization value

      • sloppyFreq

        public float sloppyFreq(int i)
        Description copied from class: BaseTFIDF
        Computes the amount of a sloppy phrase match, based on an edit distance. This value is summed for each sloppy phrase match in a document to form the frequency to be used in scoring instead of the exact term count. A phrase match with a small edit distance to a document passage more closely matches the document, so implementations of this method usually return larger values when the edit distance is small and smaller values when it is large.
        Specified by:
        sloppyFreq in class BaseTFIDF
        Parameters:
        i - the edit distance of this sloppy phrase match
        Returns:
        the frequency increment for this match
        See Also:
        PhraseQuery.getSlop()

      • scorePayload

        public float scorePayload(int i,
                          int i1,
                          int i2,
                          org.apache.lucene.util.BytesRef br)
        Description copied from class: BaseTFIDF
        Calculate a scoring factor based on the data in the payload. Implementations are responsible for interpreting what is in the payload. Lucene makes no assumptions about what is in the byte array.
        Specified by:
        scorePayload in class BaseTFIDF
        Parameters:
        i - The docId currently being scored.
        i1 - The start position of the payload
        i2 - The end position of the payload
        br - The payload byte array to be scored
        Returns:
        An implementation dependent float to be used as a scoring factor
